title: Soccer sex tape blackmail conspiracy
text:
Former Liverpool star Djibril Cisse denies any involvement in a sex tape blackmail plot Staff Writers news.com.au Former Liverpool star Djibril Cisse denies any involvement in a sex tape blackmail plot Staff Writers news.com.au Jose Mourinho fined 50,000 pounds 0:26 
EPL: Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho has been slapped with a 50,000 pound fine by the English Football Association for saying the referee was afraid to award his side penalties in their 3-1 loss to Southampton. October 15th 2015 a day ago /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/Football/EPL/ 
FRENCH striker Djibril Cisse has denied any involvement in a plot to blackmail former teammate Mathieu Valbuena with the threat of releasing a sex tape. 
The former Liverpool and France striker was one of four people arrested this week in an ongoing blackmail investigation by French police. 
English and French media have reported Mathieu is the victim of a conspiracy threat to release mobile phone video footage of the France international having sex with his partner. 
While, reports have indicated Cisse will soon be dismissed as a potential suspect, the three other people being held are believed to have attempted to blackmail Lyon player Valbuena. 
It has been reported they group claim they are in possession of the sex tape that Mathieu is said to have made with his partner. 
It is alleged the conspiracy asked Valbuena for between $78,000 to $156,000 in exchange for the sex tape. Other Stories
